subject: Law
title: The Exclusionary Rule
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Exclusionary Rule.

hook.text: Police found a murder weapon without a warrant. The evidence was perfectâ€”and completely inadmissible.

buildup.text: The exclusionary rule bars evidence obtained through illegal searches or seizures from being used at trial.

discovery.text: Mapp v. Ohio (1961) extended this rule to state courts, making it a nationwide protection.

twist.text: Critics say it lets guilty people go free. Supporters say it's the only way to deter police misconduct.

climax.text: Exceptions exist: good faith, inevitable discovery, and independent source all allow some tainted evidence in.

punchline.text: How evidence is found matters as much as what it proves.

quiz.question: What does the exclusionary rule do?
options: Bars illegally obtained evidence from trial
